result.execSummary:
The defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Physical Abuse Of A Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Physical Abuse Of A Child (Intentional Causation Of Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Physical Abuse Of A Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts 4 and 5.  Credit for 150 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow conditions of CHIPS order.
Complete a parenting class.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
Comply with the No Contact Order as set in CHIPS case.
Alcohol  and drug  assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UA's.
No use or possession of firearms.

Full time work, school or a combination.
Obtain a GED/HSED/high school diploma.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges including  DNA surcharge and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Court set restitution at $0.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she may not vote in any election until her civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Porscha Tillmanist Bowman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Porscha Tillmanist Bowman.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to counts 4, and 5, credit for 150 days. 

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to counts 3, and 5, credit for 150 days. 

AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, concurrent to counts 3, and 4, credit for 150 days. 

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Follow conditions of CHIPS order.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. Random UAs.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- Obtain a GED/HSED/High School diploma.
- Comply with no contact order as set in CHIPS case.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Court set restitution at $0.

- Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges (including DNA surcharge) and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon s/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also s/he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Porscha Tillmanist Bowman.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, AND 5:  Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she must submit a DNA sample and may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

Additionally, on the above counts, Court strikes the "Habitual Criminality Repeater" enhancer.

AS TO COUNT 1, 2, AND 6: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions - Physical Abuse of a Child
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire and Addendum
Received and Filed. Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Porscha Tillmanist Bowman.  Attorney Elaine Fehrs on behalf of Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing by zoom.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
SIGNED Stip Order Videotaped, signed and filed.

Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman in court with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective J. Pittman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder on behalf of Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Defense counsel has been appointed to the case. Court schedules case for preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court orders a respresentative from the SPD appear on the next date if an attorney is not appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
The Judge's explanation is outlined on the submitted order.  Order was revised.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DMK (04/06/2012), AAK (09/26/2016), AK (01/16/2014), RKB (07/03/2009), DK (12/03/2020), ASK, and AR
Should Childrens court become involved, any order from that court will supersede this order. There is no proceeding
currently known.

Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Porscha Tillmanist Bowman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Porscha Tillmanist Bowman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
